title: Science Phenomenon Comprehension Using Augmented Reality and Physical Manipulative Interfaces

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science concepts and fundamental smartphone operation skills
context.additional_context: Science learning activity design integrating augmented reality (AR) with tangible user interfaces (TUI) in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment.

learning_goals: Learners can visually and physically recreate at least three abstract scientific phenomena (e.g., waves, celestial motion) using AR and TUI.
Learners can explain causal relationships of scientific concepts through the interaction of physical manipulation and virtual simulation.
Learners can write a project report on scientific phenomena based on data collected in a digital-physical hybrid environment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
